page.title: 16Peoples memories of Fetcham
page.content: (continued from page 15) with a mangle to wring out the clothes. One person remembered wearing "combs", vest and knickers combined in one garment. One person was brought up in an orphanage. Their toys were hoops, tops, five stones and a real rocking horse. School was strict. Children were not allowed to dislike anything and were punished by being hit. They could leave school at 14 years of age. Some of the old Fetcham people remembered the main road as a lane or cart track. There was no street lighting and only two cottages in the Cobham Road. Most people walked, rode bicycles or used horse and cart. One person remembered open top buses, which could not go uphill with passengers! They had to walk up the hill and remount the bus at the top!
